definition: to announce to the world (idiom)/to make public/to let everyone know

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: I wish to make this matter known to the general public.
sentences.chinese: 我想要把這件事公諸於世。

sentences.english: This post is about the reason why I haven't been updating my blog.
sentences.chinese: 這一篇是要將爲何好久沒有更新的原因公諸於世。

sentences.english: Before the matter was publicly announced, it had long been in the air.
sentences.chinese: 這件事在公諸於世之前早就傳得滿城風雨。

sentences.english: The proposed sale could be announced by Monday morning, the report said.
sentences.chinese: 有報道稱，這項交易將於週一早上被公諸於世。

sentences.english: We have peaceably assembled here, as is our right, to let these facts be known.
sentences.chinese: 我們有權在這裏和平集會，並將這些事實公諸於世。

sentences.english: Bofore the matter was publicly announced, it had long been in the air.
sentences.chinese: 這件事在公諸於世之前早就傳得滿城風雨了。

sentences.english: Many new discoveries have been brought to light.
sentences.chinese: 許多新發現已公諸於世。

sentences.english: It’s surely only a matter of time before Microsoft unleashes its iPad killer on the world.
sentences.chinese: 微軟將其iPad殺手公諸於世將僅僅是個時間問題。

sentences.english: The part written in cipher – turned out after examination to be entirely unpublishable.
sentences.chinese: 用密碼記錄的內容，經過檢視完全不能公諸於世。
